hints.content: Start by understanding how to identify the largest digit in a number. You can convert the number to a string or repeatedly divide by 10 to find the maximum digit.
Consider how you will store the numbers based on their largest digit. A dictionary or a list of lists could be useful to group numbers by their largest digit.
As you iterate through the numbers, remember to extract the largest digit for each number. You can use a helper function to keep your code organized.
Think about how to handle cases where multiple numbers share the same largest digit. You will need to keep track of the two largest numbers for each digit.
Make sure to check if there are at least two numbers with the same largest digit before calculating their sum. If not, you should return -1.
When calculating the maximum sum, consider using a simple comparison to find the two largest numbers for each digit group.
Don't forget to initialize your storage for the largest numbers for each digit to handle cases where no numbers are found for a digit.
Think about edge cases, such as when all numbers have unique largest digits or when there are multiple pairs with the same sum.
As you finalize your logic, ensure that you iterate through your storage of largest numbers to find the maximum sum across all digit groups.
Your final step will involve returning the maximum sum found or -1 if no valid pairs exist. Make sure your return statement reflects this logic.

questionNotes: Return -1 if no valid pairs exist.
Consider the uniqueness of largest digits when grouping numbers.
